dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: President Tokayev just signed that prisoner transfer deal with Cyprus, didn't he?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: President Tokayev just signed that prisoner transfer deal with Cyprus, didn't he?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev has signed the law "On the Ratification of the Agreement between the Republic of Kazakhstan and the Republic of Cyprus on the Transfer of Convicted Persons."

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the one that was, uh, ratified by the Senate back on April 10th. It's official now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the one that was, uh, ratified by the Senate back on April tenth. It's official now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, on April 10, the Senate deputies ratified the document.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So this means Kazakh citizens serving time in Cyprus can come home to finish their sentences, and vice versa.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this means Kazakh citizens serving time in Cyprus can come home to finish their sentences, and vice versa.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In accordance with the agreement, the parties undertake to transfer to each other convicted persons who have been sentenced to imprisonment so that they can continue serving their sentence or the remainder of it in their country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and it's the Prosecutor General's Office in Kazakhstan that's gonna handle all those transfer decisions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and it's the Prosecutor General's Office in Kazakhstan that's gonna handle all those transfer decisions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Prosecutor General's Office has been determined as the body responsible from Kazakhstan for the execution of decisions on the transfer of convicted persons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But they can still say no, right? Like if it's a security risk or something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they can still say no, right? Like if it's a security risk or something.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, the transfer may be refused if it may harm the sovereignty, security or public order of the country that issued the sentence, if the convicted person has not compensated for the damages ordered by the court, and also if the person is still being prosecuted in the country that issued the sentence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh for sureâ€”if it threatens public order or, um, if the person hasn't paid court-ordered damages yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh for sure-if it threatens public order or, um, if the person hasn't paid court-ordered damages yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, the transfer may be refused if it may harm the sovereignty, security or public order of the country that issued the sentence, if the convicted person has not compensated for the damages ordered by the court, and also if the person is still being prosecuted in the country that issued the sentence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Makes sense. I wonder how many people this actually affects.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes sense. I wonder how many people this actually affects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Probably not a huge number, but it's a big deal for those families, you know? Getting to be closer to home.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Probably not a huge number, but it's a big deal for those families, you know? Getting to be closer to home.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it was signed in Astana last March during that Cypriot foreign minister's visit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it was signed in Astana last March during that Cypriot foreign minister's visit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On March 25, in Astana, as part of the official visit of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Cyprus to Kazakhstan, a ceremony was held to sign an agreement between the two countries on the transfer of convicted persons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so it's been in the works for over a year now. Glad it's finally moving forward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so it's been in the works for over a year now. Glad it's finally moving forward.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The agreement was signed in Astana in March of last year. The official announcement was released by the press service of Akorda on Wednesday, April 16.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely feels like a step toward more international cooperation, even on the trickier stuff like justice.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely feels like a step toward more international cooperation, even on the trickier stuff like justice.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's one of those agreements that sounds bureaucratic but has real human impact.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's one of those agreements that sounds bureaucratic but has real human impact.
